title: Market Brief: U.S. Stocks Dip Alongside European Currencies In Quiet Trade
text:
Market Brief: U.S. Stocks Dip Alongside European Currencies In Quiet Trade

Matthew WellerStock Markets 51 minutes ago (Sep 27, 2019 02:30AM ET) By

www.investing.com/analysis/market-brief-us-stocks-dip-alongside-european-currencies-in-quiet-trade-200468591 Market Brief: U.S. Stocks Dip Alongside European Currencies In Quiet Trade By By Matthew Weller | 51 minutes ago (Sep 27, 2019 02:30AM ET)

Follow Daily % Candles The latest news in the U.S.-China trade war is that the U.S. is unlikely to extend waivers for companies to do business with Chinese handset maker Huawei. FX: The was the strongest major currency on the day, while the Swiss brought up the rear. We’re also keeping a close eye on the breakdown in This morning’s U.S. data came out almost exactly as expected across the board: Q2 (3rd reading) came in at 2.0% as anticipated, Weekly jobless claims printed at 213k vs. 212k eyed, and August trade balance was -72.8B vs. -73.4B expected, and pending home sales beat at 1.6% vs. 1.0% anticipated. Commodities: and were essentially flat on the day. Cryptoassets took another leg lower today, with market benchmark briefly breaking below $8,000 before recovering back above that level as of writing. US Cash Indices % Change U.S. indices edged lower in quiet trade today. REITs (XLRE) were the strongest sector on the day while Energy stocks (XLE (NYSE: )) were the weakest. Stocks on the move: Beyond Meat Inc (NASDAQ: ) tacked on 12% after McDonald’s (NYSE: , +0%) announced it would be testing Beyond burgers in Ontario. Rite Aid Corporation (NYSE: ) tacked on 3% after reporting better-than-expected Q2 earnings. Peloton (NASDAQ: )(PTON) dropped -11% in its first of trading as a public company. Economic Calendar Original Post
